title: Alyssa Milano talks up children's book Hope on GMA two years after her #MeToo sexual abuse tweet
text:
It's been two years since Alyssa Milano tweeted the #MeToo hashtag that started a global movement among women - and men - who had been sexually abused.

Now the actress and activist has written her first children's book, Hope: Project Middle School, with co-author Debbie Rigaud.

And the 46-year-old turned up at the Good Morning America studios in New York City to talk about it.

Suited up: Alyssa Milano talked up her children's book, Hope: Project Middle School, co-authored by Debbie Rigaud, at GMA in New York City on Monday morning

The Who's The Boss? star looked bright and beautiful outside the studio.

The siren had on a yellow pants suit that she wore over a black camisole with black strappy sandals.

The beautiful brunette carried a large black ball and chain purse and she stopped to pose for snappers.

Bright and beautiful: The 46-year-old actress and MeToo activist looked radiant in yellow suit and black camisole as she carried a black ball and chain purse

Alyssa's book is about 11-year-old Hope Roberts who 'dreams big' and 'believes it's always a good day to champion a cause, defend an underdog, and save the future,' according to Google Books.

That certainly describes the actress's life.

Alyssa has frequently said she had no idea the tweet she sent out on October 15, 2017, would go viral.

Her new project: Alyssa's children's book is about 11-year-old Hope who 'believes it's always a good day to champion a cause, defend an underdog, and save the future'

Small beginnings; The tweet that Alyssa posted on October 15, 2017, started a huge movement, causing the downfall of such celebrities as Harvey Weinstein

Going viral: The hashtag received 19 million views in its first year

It was seen 19 million times in the first year.

It lead to the downfall of filmmaker Harvey Weinstein, among others, who is facing sexual abuse allegations in court.

Alyssa was, in fact, continuing the work of civil rights activist Tarana Burke, 46, who founded the MeToo movement in 2006.
description: The actress and activist, 46, has co-written a book about Hope, an 11-year-old with big dreams, to inspire other youngsters She looked bright and beautiful in a yellow pants suit outside NYC studio.
